title: SpaceX conducts a mostly successful test of its Super Heavy booster
summary: There were positives and negatives to be taken away from the test firing.

title: SpaceX performs static fire test of Booster 9
summary: Following two prior tests of the water deluge system and a spin prime test of Booster 9, SpaceX lit all 33 engines...

title: Lockheed Martin opens new factory focused on small satellites
summary: Lockheed Martin, a company that for decades has built schoolbus-sized satellites for the U.S. government, opened a new facility to assemble small satellites, which are now in higher demand.

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy August 6-12, 2023
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of August 6-12, 2023 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in recess […]

title: ISS transition plans a work in progress
summary: Plans for shifting research from the International Space Station to commercial space stations late this decade are still a work in progress, NASA and industry officials say.

title: LeoStella unveils its largest smallsat to target SDA contracts
summary: LeoStella announced details about its largest spacecraft yet Aug. 6 with plans to deliver its first two 500-kilogram-class satellites to a commercial radar constellation customer next summer.

title: Chandrayaan-3 Reaches Lunar Orbit, Landing Soon with Russia, Japan and U.S. Close Behind
summary: India’s Chandrayaan-3 reached lunar orbit today enroute to a landing in less than three weeks. It is the country’s second attempt to land on the Moon. The success rate for […]

title: After 11 years on Mars, Curiosity continues to climb the slopes of Mount Sharp
summary: On Aug. 6, 2012, NASA’s Mars Science Laboratory mission, comprised of the new Curiosity rover, officially began when Curiosity was successfully lowered onto the Martian surface via a first-of-its-kind skycrane. Curiosity‘s landing location was at the base of Mount Sharp (officially referred to as Aeolis Mons) in Gale Crater — a 3.5 billion-year-old crater that scientists believe was once a lake.

title: NASA, ESA, CSA, and JAXA Commit To ISS Operations Through 2030
summary: NASA and its three Western partners, Canada, Europe, and Japan, confirmed plans to extend ISS operations through 2030 during a recent panel session at the International Space Station Research and Development Conference.

title: ISRO Chandrayaan-3 Lunar Orbit Confirmed
summary: India is gearing up for its second lunar landing attempt as the Chandrayaan-3 spacecraft successfully arrived in lunar orbit.
